Package space.sunqian.common.runtime.proxy

Interface ProxyHandler

public interface ProxyHandler
The ProxyHandler is an interface used to handle proxy behavior, including determining whether a method needs to be proxied (needsProxy(Method)) and the specific behavior of the proxy method (invoke(Object, Method, ProxyInvoker, Object...)).

This interface is typically used for ProxyMaker.make(Class, List, ProxyHandler).

  • Method Details

    • needsProxy

      boolean needsProxy(@Nonnull @Nonnull Method method)
      Returns whether the given method should be proxied.

      Typically, the ProxyMaker invokes this method for each proxiable method of the proxied class and interfaces, only once. If there are methods with the same name and JVM descriptor, ProxyMaker only passes the first one encountered. Note some implementations may not have this guarantee.

      Parameters:
      method - the given method
      Returns:
      whether the given method should be proxied

    • invoke

      @Nullable @Nullable Object invoke(@Nonnull @Nonnull Object proxy, @Nonnull @Nonnull Method method, @Nonnull @Nonnull ProxyInvoker invoker, Object @Nonnull ... args) throws Throwable
      Defines the proxy behavior for the proxied method. When a proxied method is invoked on a proxy instance, this method will be called to handle the invocation.
      Parameters:
      proxy - the proxy instance on which the method was invoked
      method - the proxied method being invoked
      invoker - the invoker that can be used to invoke the original behavior (call super)
      args - the arguments for the method invocation
      Returns:
      the invocation result
      Throws:
      Throwable - the bare exception thrown by the invocation, without any wrapping
